Package strategies

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    StackableStrategy
    Stackable strategies are strategies that can be used one after the other.
    Strategy
    Interface that represents a strategy that can be used to determine a move in the Othello game.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    FieldValueStrategy
    This strategy is based on the positional values from the publication ....
    LimitingStrategy
    This strategy is based on the premise of giving your opponent the least possible moves, since this may cause you to get more moves.
    MiniMaxStrategy
    The minimax strategy looks at n turns in the future to determine what is the best move, assuming the opponent has perfect play.
    MiniMaxStrategy.Node
    A node in the minimax tree.
    NaiveStrategy
    Implementation of a naive strategy, which chooses a random legal move.
    StackStrategy
    The stack strategy is an implementation of other Stackable strategies.
